overview_summary: None of the five nearby landowners have a clear public stance on the proposed development, as no explicit support or opposition has been documented. Their community influence appears limited – none hold public office or prominent civic roles – although one couple owns substantial land which could confer some local sway.

neighbors.name: Michael B. Tierney
neighbors.claims: Michael B. Tierney is based in the Fredericksburg area and works as an independent contractor in real estate ([projects.propublica.org](https://projects.propublica.org/coronavirus/bailouts/loans/michael-b-tierney-1389717901#:~:text=Fredericksburg%2C%20VA)). He obtained a ~$7,000 Paycheck Protection Program loan in June 2020 (first-round COVID-19 relief), which was fully forgiven ([projects.propublica.org](https://projects.propublica.org/coronavirus/bailouts/loans/michael-b-tierney-1389717901#:~:text=Loan%20Amount)) ([projects.propublica.org](https://projects.propublica.org/coronavirus/bailouts/loans/michael-b-tierney-1389717901#:~:text=Date%20Approved)). No public record was found of Tierney speaking about local development proposals ([www.spotsylvania.va.us](https://www.spotsylvania.va.us/1261/Meeting-Minutes#:~:text=Skip%20to%20Main%20Content%20Early,Read%20On)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a peer from the real estate community reach out to discuss how the project could positively impact property values and market trends in the area.

neighbors.name: Steven D. Cronberry & Tonya C. Williams
neighbors.claims: Steven D. Cronberry and Tonya C. Williams are listed as co-owners of a residential parcel (PIN 21M-2-22) in Spotsylvania County ([apps.spotsylvaniacountyva.gov](https://apps.spotsylvaniacountyva.gov/assessment/assessment/index.cfm#:~:text=Spotsylvania%20County%20Assessment%20Values%20Real,of%20Revenue%20has%20attempted%20to)). They have no identifiable presence in local news or county meeting records related to development issues ([patch.com](https://patch.com/virginia/fredericksburg/bp--spotsylvania-county-sheriffs-office-arrests-december-10-20#:~:text=Spotsylvania%20County%20Sheriff%27s%20Office%20Arrests,at%20PNC%20Bank%20at%20Hilltop)). Their profile suggests private residents with no noted civic roles or public commentary on community projects ([patch.com](https://patch.com/virginia/fredericksburg/bp--spotsylvania-county-sheriffs-office-arrests-december-10-20#:~:text=On%2012%2F13%2F2012%20Deputy%20Friedman%20arrested,at%20PNC%20Bank%20at%20Hilltop)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via a friendly community liaison to introduce the project and invite their feedback, emphasizing a willingness to address any concerns about maintaining their quality of life.

neighbors.name: Richard Vance Thompson & Kimberly M. Thompson
neighbors.claims: Richard V. Thompson and Kimberly M. Thompson jointly own four adjacent parcels in Spotsylvania (tax map 21-8), indicating a significant land holding ([apps.spotsylvaniacountyva.gov](https://apps.spotsylvaniacountyva.gov/assessment/assessment/index.cfm#:~:text=public%20information,of%20Revenue%20has%20attempted%20to)). These parcels suggest the Thompsons control considerable acreage, though they have not publicly engaged in local planning debates as of the latest records ([www.spotsylvania.va.us](https://www.spotsylvania.va.us/1261/Meeting-Minutes#:~:text=Skip%20to%20Main%20Content%20Early,Read%20On)). No public statements or letters from the Thompsons regarding development or energy projects were found in county archives ([www.spotsylvania.va.us](https://www.spotsylvania.va.us/2683/Board-of-Supervisors-Budget-Questions-Re#:~:text=,position%20was%20vacant%20or%20not)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through an agriculture-friendly intermediary (e.g., a local farm bureau member) to acknowledge their land stewardship and discuss how the project can coexist with rural land preservation priorities.

neighbors.name: Ronald C. Julien Jr. & Tamaira K. Caines-Julien
neighbors.claims: Ronald C. Julien Jr. and Tamaira K. Caines-Julien are co-owners of a Spotsylvania property (PIN 21M-2-23), but they maintain a low public profile ([apps.spotsylvaniacountyva.gov](https://apps.spotsylvaniacountyva.gov/assessment/assessment/index.cfm#:~:text=Spotsylvania%20County%20Assessment%20Values%20Real,of%20Revenue%20has%20attempted%20to)). No references to the Julien family have been found in local civic news, suggesting they have not taken visible stands on community development issues ([www.poegen.net](https://www.poegen.net/VA/Spotsylvania/#:~:text=Browning%20acknowledged%20this%20his%20Deed,land%20to%20Edward%20Rowzee%20which)). They are not recorded as holding any local leadership positions or voicing opinions in county meetings ([nextdoor.com](https://nextdoor.com/agency-post/va/spotsylvania/spotsylvania-sheriffs-office/arrests-made-february-09-16-2018-76633936/#:~:text=,Norris%2C%20with%20the)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Outreach should be personal and trust-building; invite them to informational sessions or one-on-one meetings to understand their views, since their concerns are not yet publicly known.

neighbors.name: Bradley James Sams & Crystal Lee Sams
neighbors.claims: Bradley J. Sams and Crystal L. Sams own a residential parcel identified as PIN 21M-2-17 in Spotsylvania ([etrakit.spotsylvania.va.us](https://etrakit.spotsylvania.va.us/etrakit/Search/parcel.aspx#:~:text=Property%20Search)). Public records of Crystal L. Sams indicate prior addresses in Camp Lejeune, NC and Hawaii, hinting at a military family background ([freepeoplesearch.com](https://freepeoplesearch.com/Sams/Crystal/#:~:text=Crystal%20Sams%20Fredericksburg%2C%20VA%20,March%201973)). The Sams have not been cited in local media or meeting minutes concerning development matters, implying no known stance to date ([www.fxbgadvance.com](https://www.fxbgadvance.com/p/commentary-spotsylvania-stares-into#:~:text=COMMENTARY%3A%20Spotsylvania%20Stares%20into%20Abyss%2C,CHIEF%20At)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a community representative with a military background reach out to establish rapport. Emphasize respect and transparency, and highlight any community benefits in terms of safety or local values to connect with their likely priorities.
